member.name: T:System.TimeSpan2
member.summary: Represents a time interval.
member.remarks: A TimeSpan2 object represents a time interval (duration of time or elapsed time) that is measured as a positive or negative number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and fractions of a second. The TimeSpan2 structure can also be used to represent the time of day, but only if the time is unrelated to a particular date.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.MaxValue
member.summary: Represents the maximum value. This field is read-only.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.MinValue
member.summary: Represents the minimum value. This field is read-only.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.Zero
member.summary: Represents the zero value. This field is read-only.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.TicksPerDay
member.summary: Represents the number of ticks in 1 day. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.TicksPerHour
member.summary: Represents the number of ticks in 1 hour. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.TicksPerMillisecond
member.summary: Represents the number of ticks in 1 millisecond. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.TicksPerMinute
member.summary: Represents the number of ticks in 1 minute. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.TimeSpan2.TicksPerSecond
member.summary: Represents the number of ticks in 1 second. This field is constant.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.Days
member.summary: Gets the days component of the time interval represented by the current structure.
member.value: The day component of this instance. The return value can be positive or negative.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.Hours
member.summary: Gets the hours component of the time interval represented by the current structure.
member.value: The hours component of this instance. The return value ranges from -23 through 23.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.IsZero
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is zero.
member.value: true if this instance is zero; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.Milliseconds
member.summary: Gets the milliseconds component of the time interval represented by the current structure.
member.value: The milliseconds component of this instance. The return value ranges from -999 through 999.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.Minutes
member.summary: Gets the minutes component of the time interval represented by the current structure.
member.value: The minutes component of this instance. The return value ranges from -59 through 59.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.Seconds
member.summary: Gets the seconds component of the time interval represented by the current structure.
member.value: The seconds component of this instance. The return value ranges from -59 through 59.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.Ticks
member.summary: Gets the number of ticks that represent the value of the current structure.
member.value: The number of ticks contained in this instance.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.TotalDays
member.summary: Gets the value of the current structure expressed in whole and fractional days.
member.value: The total number of days represented by this instance.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.TotalHours
member.summary: Gets the value of the current structure expressed in whole and fractional hours.
member.value: The total number of hours represented by this instance.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.TotalMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the value of the current structure expressed in whole and fractional milliseconds.
member.value: The total number of milliseconds represented by this instance.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.TotalMinutes
member.summary: Gets the value of the current structure expressed in whole and fractional minutes.
member.value: The total number of minutes represented by this instance.

member.name: P:System.TimeSpan2.TotalSeconds
member.summary: Gets the value of the current structure expressed in whole and fractional seconds.
member.value: The total number of seconds represented by this instance.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.TryParse(System.String,System.TimeSpan2@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a time span to convert.

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the time span contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or TimeSpan.Zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null, is an empty string (""), or does not contain a valid string representation of a time span. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.TryParse(System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.TimeSpan2@)

member.param: A string containing a time span to convert.
An object that supplies culture-specific format information about .

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the time span contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or TimeSpan.Zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null, is an empty string (""), or does not contain a valid string representation of a time span. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.TimeSpan2@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a time interval to its equivalent by using the specified format and culture-specific format information, and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded. The format of the string representation must match the specified format exactly.
member.param: A string that specifies the time interval to convert.
A standard or custom format string that defines the required format of .
An object that supplies culture-specific format information about .
When this method returns, contains an object that represents the time interval specified by , or if the conversion failed. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String[],System.IFormatProvider,System.TimeSpan2@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a time interval to its equivalent by using the specified formats and culture-specific format information, and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded. The format of the string representation must match one of the specified formats exactly.
member.param: A string that specifies the time interval to convert.
A array of standard or custom format strings that define the acceptable formats of .
An object that supplies culture-specific format information about .
When this method returns, contains an object that represents the time interval specified by , or if the conversion failed. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Returns string representation of the value of this instance using the specified format.
member.param: A TimeSpan format string.
An object that supplies format information about the current instance.
member.returns: A string representation of value of the current object as specified by format.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns string representation of the value of this instance using the specified format.
member.param: A TimeSpan format string.
member.returns: A string representation of value of the current object as specified by format.

remarks.para: The following table lists the standard TimeSpan format patterns.

item.description:
This specifier is not culture-sensitive. It takes the form
[-][d’.’]hh’:’mm’:’ss[‘.’fffffff]
.

This specifier outputs only what is needed. It is culture-sensitive and takes the form
[-][d’:’]h’:’mm’:’ss[.FFFFFFF]
.

This specifier always outputs days and seven fractional digits. It is culture-sensitive and takes the form
[-]d’:’hh’:’mm’:’ss.fffffff
.

This specifier outputs days, hours, minutes and seconds in the style defined by JIRA. It takes the form
[w'w'] [d'd'] [h'h'] [m'm'] [s's']
.

This specifier outputs days, hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds in the style defined by ISO 8601. It takes the form
'P'[d'D']['T'[h'H'][m'M'][p3'S']]
.

remarks.para: The following table lists the standard TimeSpan format patterns.

item.description: The number of whole days in the time interval.
The number of whole days in the time interval, padded with leading zeros as needed.
The number of whole hours in the time interval that are not counted as part of days. Single-digit hours do not have a leading zero.
The number of whole hours in the time interval that are not counted as part of days. Single-digit hours have a leading zero.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the value of this instance.
member.returns:
A string that represents the value of this instance. The return value is of the form:
[-][d.]hh:mm:ss[.fffffff]

member.name: M:System.Globalization.TimeSpan2FormatInfo.Format(System.String,System.Object,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Converts the value of the object to its equivalent string representation using the specified format.
member.param: A TimeSpan format string.
An object to format.
An object that supplies format information about the current instance.
member.returns: A string representation of value of the current object as specified by format.
member.remarks:
The following table lists the standard TimeSpan format patterns associated with TimeSpan2FormatInfo properties.
Format pattern Associated Property/Description
d Localized string for TotalDays
f Full localized string displaying each time element with separator between
h Localized string for TotalHours
j JIRA style output
m Localized string for TotalMinutes
n Standard TimeSpan format (00:00:00:00)
s Localized string for TotalSeconds
t Localized string for TotalMilliseconds
x ISO 8601 XML standard for durations

member.returns: An array containing the standard patterns in which values can be formatted.

An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about .

member.name: M:System.Globalization.TimeSpan2FormatInfo.ParseExact(System.String,System.String[],System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a time span to its equivalent using the specified format and culture-specific format information. The format of the string representation must match the specified format exactly.
member.param: A string containing a time span to parse.
An array of standard or custom format strings that define the required format of .
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about .
member.returns: A equivalent to the time span contained in as specified by and .

member.name: M:System.Globalization.TimeSpan2FormatInfo.TryParse(System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.TimeSpan@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a time span to convert.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about .

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the time span contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or TimeSpan.Zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null, is an empty string (""), or does not contain a valid string representation of a time span. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.TimeSpan2FormatInfo.TryParseExact(System.String,System.String[],System.IFormatProvider,System.TimeSpan@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a time span to convert.
An array of allowable formats of .
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about .

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the time span contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or TimeSpan.Zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if or is null, or an element of is an empty string, or the format of is not exactly as specified by at least one of the format patterns in . This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
